question: Hear me? Cap'n? Some kinda compromise to the hull...holding for now, but...Goddamn, I'm glad you're alive. Gotta pull your E-release...no, red handle, red handle. I'll get the warm-ups out while --
answer: Why did I fall on you?

question: He's dead. Cap'n's dead. Christ, I was looking right at him when --
answer: I mean, I mean, chrono shows we're 22 weeks out, so gravity wasn't supposed to kick in for another 19. I mean, I mean, I mean, why did I fall at all?

question: You hear me? Captain's dead. Owens too.
answer: Oh, no. Not Owens, not.... Wai', wai', wait. I'm Owens. Right?

question: Fry?
answer: Can't get my nose down...too much load back there....

question: You mean that "load" of passengers?
answer: So what, we should both go down too? Out of sheer fucking nobility?

question: Look, Fry. Company says we're responsible for every one of those --
answer: Company's not here, is it?

question: When captain went down, you stepped up -- whether you like it or not. Now they train you for this, so --
answer: And there wasn't a simulated cockroach alive within 50 clicks of the simulated crash site! That's how they train you! On a fucking simulator!

question: Don't touch that switch!
answer: I'm not dying for them.

question: One chance and you blew it, Riddick. Never cease to disappoint me.
answer: Hey.

question: Hey, who?
answer: Hey, me. Over here.

question: Amazing. I'm Johns.
answer: Carolyn Fry. I'd shake hands, but... Are there any others, Johns?

question: And him?
answer: Big Evil?

question: We just keep him locked up forever?
answer: Be my choice. Already escaped once from the max-slam facility on --

question: I don't need his life story. Is he really that dangerous?
answer: Only around humans.

question: Maratha crow-bill war-picks from Northern India. Very rare.
answer: An' this?

question: Blow-dart hunting stick from Papua New Guinea. Very very rare, since the tribe's extinct.
answer: 'Cuz they couldn't hunt shit with these things, be my guess.

question: So quiet. You get used to the sounds of the ship, then....
answer: You know who Muhammad was?

question: Some prophet guy?
answer: "Some prophet guy." And a city man. But he had to travel to the desert -- where there was quiet -- to hear the words of God.

question: You were on a pilgrimage? To New Mecca?
answer: Chrislam teaches that once in every lifetime should there be a great hajj -- a great pilgrimage. To know God, better, yes, but to know yourself as well.

question: Frightening thought.
answer: We're all on the same hajj now.

question: Long time ago. Whatever happened.
answer: Probably makes it worse. Dehydrates you even more.

question: Probably right. You know, I woulda played road dog for these guys. You could've stayed back. Pro'bly should've -- because, you know, if we don't find water....
answer: No, no, I wanted to get away.

question: So I noticed. Never seen a "captain" quite so ready to leave her ship.
answer: Better keep moving....

question: What'd Owens mean? 'Bout not touching the switch? Hey. You can tell me, Carolyn.
answer: Promise me. Swear to me you won't --

question: You see anybody else here? Just between you and me.
answer: During the landing...when things were at their worst...Owens was at his best. He's the one who wouldn't let the pilot dump the passenger cabin. So now you know.

question: Fuck. Guess I'm more glad to be here than I thought. Hold up. Didn't bite.
answer: What?

question: Thought he might be coolin' it in the boneyard -- could either double-back to the ship or slip in behind us. So I left the bottle out as bait. But nah. Didn't bite.
answer: Wait, wait, wait....

question: Audrey? Oh, Audrey....
answer: What?

question: Tell me that was you.
answer: Okay, it was me. What'd I do now?

question: So where is he? Tell me about the sounds. You told them you heard something right before.... If you don't talk to me, Johns'll take another crack at it -- at your skull.
answer: 'Mean the whispers?

question: What whispers?
answer: The ones tellin' me to go for the sweet spot -- just to the left of the spine, fourth lumbar down. The abdominal aorta. What a gusher. Had a cup on his belt, so I used it to catch a little run-off. Metallic taste to it, human blood. Coppery. But if you cut it with peppermint schnapps, that goes away. Course, that's more for winter. Summertime, I take mine straight.

question: Why don't we try the truth now?
answer: All you people are so scared of me -- an' most days, I'd take that as a compliment -- but it ain't me you gotta worry about now.

question: Show me your eyes. Show me, Riddick. You did this? To yourself?
answer: Slam doctor. Well, we called him "doctor."

question: Heard about it. Just never seen it.
answer: Fairly fuckin' ironic, wouldn't you say? Slamlight's so dim that you go and get your eyeballs taken out and shined up -- then you wind up here. Three ass-kick suns. Maybe I did do a few people. But not this one. No ma'am, not this time.

question: Then where is he? He's not in the hole. We looked.
answer: Look deeper.

question: I know what happened -- he went off on the guy, buried him on the hill somewhere, and now he's trying to --
answer: Let's just be sure.

question: I am sure. Look, murders aside, Riddick belongs in the Asshole Hall of Fame. He loves the jaw-jackin', loves making you afraid, 'cuz that's all he has. And you're playing right into --
answer: We're gonna find the body, Johns. Christ, you're a cop. Why am I tellin' you this? We gotta go down and find it.

question: Well, don't ask me to.
answer: Thought you didn't believe his story.

question: Nobody else is going down but me, okay?
answer: Hey. Bein' ballsy with your life now doesn't change what came before -- it's just stupid.

question: What, you think I'm doin' this to prove something?
answer: You said it, not me. Let's just not let one bad call lead to another.

question: Found somethin' worse than me, huh?
answer: We're movin'. And I'm just wondering if I shouldn't lighten the load right now.

question: Woof, woof.
answer: Want you to remember this moment, Riddick. The way it coulda gone and didn't.

question: Say that again.
answer: Here's the deal. You work without the chains, without the bit -- without the shivs. You help us get off this rock....

question: For what? The honor of goin' back to some asshole of a cell?
answer: Truth is, Riddick, I'm tired of this head-up shit. I wanna be free of you as much as you wanna be free of me.

question: You'd cut me loose, Boss?
answer: Only if we both get outta this alive. And there may be a way.

question: My recommendation
answer: If you were me, I'd kill us both. C'mon, you wanna sit at the grown-up table or not?

question: Other buildings weren't secure... ...so they ran here. Heaviest doors. Thought they'd be safe inside, but... Someone forget to lock the back door.
answer: So that's what come of me Zeke. An' you saw it. You was right there. You were tryin' to kill him too.

question: Just wanted his O-2. Though I notice he tried to ghost my ass. When he shot up that stranger instead.
answer: Take it.

question: What, it's broken?
answer: Startin' to acclimate, anyhow. Take it.

question: ...need those cells from the crash ship. Shit, still gotta check out the hull, patch the wings --
answer: Let's wait on the power cells.

question: Wait for what? Until it's so dark we can't even find our way back to --
answer: We're not sure when it happens, so let's not --

question: Get the fucking cells over here, Johns. What's the discussion?
answer: Ever tell you how Riddick escaped?

question: He can pilot?
answer: Hijacked a prison transport, made a helluva good run 'fore I tracked him down.

question: Okay, maybe that's a good thing. Maybe I can use him to help with --
answer: He also figured out how to kill the pilot, Fry.

question: You said we were going to trust him now. You said there was a deal.
answer: That's what I said.

question: Oh, this is a dangerous game you're playing, Johns.
answer: May've noticed chains don't work on this guy. Only way we're truly safe is if he believes he's goin' free. But if he stops believin' --

question: You mean, if he learns that you're gonna royally fuck him over.
answer: -- we need a fail-safe. Bring the cells over at the last possible minute -- when the wings are ready, when we know we're ready to launch.

question: You know, he hasn't harmed any of us. Far as I can tell, he hasn't even lied to us. Just stick to the deal, Johns. Let him go if that's what it --
answer: He's a murderer. The law says he's gotta do his bid.

question: Dancin' on razor blades here...
answer: I won't give him a chance to grab another ship -- or to slash another pilot's throat.

question: Looks like we're a few shy.... Power cells.
answer: They're coming.

question: Strange, not doin' a run-up on the main drive yet. Strange unless he told you the particulars of my escape.
answer: I got the quick-and-ugly version.

question: An' now you're worried about a repeat of history?
answer: Entered our minds.

question: I asked what you thought.
answer: You scare me, Riddick. That's what you wanna hear, isn't it? There, I admit it, Can I get back to work now?

question: Think Johns is an do-right man? You think I can trust him to cut me loose?
answer: Why, what'd you hear?

question: Well, guess if it was trickeration he'd just do me, huh? Then again...I am worth twice as much alive. Didn't know? Johns ain't a cop. Oh, he's got that shiny badge an' all, but nah -- he's just a merc and I'm just a payday. That's why he won't kill me. The creed is greed.
answer: Save it, Riddick. We aren't gonna turn on each other -- no matter how hard you try.

question: I don't truly know what's gonna happen when the lights go out, Carolyn -- but I do know that once the dyin' starts, this little psycho family of ours is gonna rip itself apart. So you better find out the truth. Come nightfall, you better know exactly who's standing behind you. Oh, ask him 'bout those shakes. And ask why your crew-pal had to scream like that 'fore he died.
answer: Who are you? Really? You're not a real cop, are you? Just some mercenary who goes around talkin' about the law like --

question: Who are you? Really? You're not a real cop, are you? Just some mercenary who goes around talkin' about the law like --
answer: I never said I was.

question: Never said you were a hype, either.
answer: You have a little caffeine in the morning, I have a little morphine. So what?

question: And here you got two mornings every day. Wow, were you born lucky?
answer: Not a problem unless you're gonna make --

question: You made it a problem when you let Owens die like that. When you had enough drugs to knock out a fucking mule-team.
answer: Owens was already dead. His brain just hadn't caught on to that fact.

question: Anything else we should know about you, Johns? Christ, here I am lettin' you play games with our lives when --
answer: My first run-in with Riddick. Went for the sweet-spot and missed. They had to leave a piece of the shiv in there. I can feel it, sometimes, pressing against the cord. So maybe the care and feeding of my nerve-endings is my business.

question: You coulda helped. And you didn't.
answer: Yeah, well, look to thine own ass first. Right, "captain"?

question: ...one cutting torch...one handlight here, two more in the cabin...I think two more....
answer: Spirits. Anything over 45 proof burns well.

question: How many bottles?
answer: Not sure. Ten?

question: Those umbrellas, the ones that mist. Would they burn? If you got a receipt?
answer: Possibly.

question: Those suns gotta come back sometime. And if these animals really are phobic about light, we just sit tight till then.
answer: I'm sure that's what someone else said. Locked inside that coring room.

question: Look, we gotta think about everyone now -- the kid especially. How scared is she gonna be out there?
answer: Oh, don't use her like that, for a smoke screen.

question: Smoke screen for what?
answer: For your own fear.

question: Hey. Why don't you rag your hole for two seconds and let someone else come up with a plan that doesn't involve MASS SUICIDE?
answer: How much you weigh, Johns?

question: What the hell's it matter?
answer: How much?

question: 79 kilos.
answer: Because you're 79 kilos of gutless white meat, and that's why you can't come up with a better plan.

question: Looks clear.
answer: Fuck me. You said "clear."

question: Said "looks clear."
answer: Well, what's it look like now?

question: Just get the goddamn lights on.... Ready, Johns.
answer: He'll lead you over the first cliff. You know that, don't you?

question: We're just burnin' light here.
answer: You give him the cells and the ship -- and he will leave you. He will leave you all out there to die.

question: I don't get it, Johns. What is so goddamn valuable in your life that you're worried about losing? Huh? Is there anything at all? Besides your next hype? Got no right to be so scared. Neither one of us. Keep the light going. That's all we have to do to live through this. Just keep your light burning.
answer: Be runnin' about 10 paces ahead. I want light on my back -- but not in my eyes. And check your cuts. These things know our blood now.

question: Riddick...was thinkin' we should make some kind of deal. Just in case, you know, this actually --
answer: Had it with deals.

question: But I just wanted to say --
answer: Nobody's gonna turn a murderer loose. I fuckin' knew better. Been a long time since anyone's trusted me. That's somethin' right there.

question: We can, can't we? Trust you?
answer: Actually... That's what I been askin' myself.

question: It's not gonna work. We gotta go back.
answer: Hey, you're the one who got me out here, turned me into a goddamn sled dog. An' now you 'spect me to go back like a whipped dog?

question: I was wrong. I admit it. My bad, okay? Now let's just go back to the ship.
answer: I dunno. Nice breeze, wide open spaces -- you know, I'm startin' to enjoy myself out here.

question: Are you fucking high again? Just listen to --
answer: No, no, you're right, Fry. What's to be afraid of? My life is a steamin' pile of meaningless toadshit anyhow. So I say mush on! Canyon's only couple hundred meters, after that we're in Skiff City! So why don't you just butch up, stuff a cork in that kid, and get --

question: During the crash, she --
answer: This does not help us, Johns.

question: -- she tried to blow the whole fucking passenger cabin, tried to kill us --
answer: Just shut up, okay?

question: -- tried to kill us in our sleep. Paris had it right -- we are disposable. We're just walking ghosts to her.
answer: Would you RAG YOUR STUPID HOLE!

question: We're not alive because of her -- we're alive in spite of her.
answer: We cannot go through there....

question: Ain't all of us gonna make it.
answer: Just realized that, huh?

question: Six of us left. If we could get through that canyon and lose just one, that'd be quite a fucking feat, huh? A good thing, right?
answer: Not if I'm the one.

question: Look, it's hellified stuff -- but no different than those battlefield doctors when they have to decide who lives and who dies. It's called "triage," okay?
answer: Kept calling it "murder" when I did it.

question: Either way, figure it's something you can grab onto.
answer: Sacrifice play. Hack up one body, leave it at start of the canyon. Like a bucket of chum.

question: Trawl with it. There's a cable on the sled. We can drag the body behind us.
answer: Nice embellishment.

question: Don't wanna feed these land-sharks -- just keep 'em off our scent.
answer: So which one caught your eye?

question: Imam. Slow down.
answer: What?

question: Don't stop, just slow down. Little more space 'tween us and them.
answer: I would rather we all stay--

question: What's her name, anyway?
answer: What do you care? Then let's not name the Thanksgiving turkey, okay? I assume you still got a shiv.

question: What, you 'spect me to do it?
answer: What's one more to you? Like this is the one that sends you to Hell?

question: What're you doin'?
answer: Blessing you like the others. It's painless.

question: And pointless.
answer: I see. Well, even if you don't believe in God, it doesn't mean He won't be --

question: You don't see. 'Cuz you don't spend half your life in lock-down with a horse-bit in your mouth and not believe. And you surely don't start out in a liquor store trash bin with an umbilical cord wrapped around your neck and not believe. Oh, absolutely I believe in God. And I absolutely hate the fucker.
answer: He will be with us. Nonetheless.

question: Didn't know who he was fuckin' with.
answer: Suleiman!

question: Get the girl back under. Keep going.
answer: SULEIMAN!

question: Strong survival instinct. Admire that in a woman.
answer: You're not leaving. Not until we go back for the others. I promised them we'd go back with more light. And that's exactly what we're gonna do..

question: Think you've mistaken me for somebody who gives a fuck.
answer: What, you're afraid?

question: Confusin' me with Johns now -- fear was his monkey. I only deal in life and death. All that stuff in between? Some shade of grey my eyes don't see.
answer: I trusted you, Riddick. Goddamn, I trusted that some part of you wanted to rejoin the human race.

question: Truthfully? I wouldn't know how.
answer: Then wait for me. I'll go back myself. Just give me more light for them. Just come with me!

question: Got a better idea. Come with me. They're already dead. Get on board.
answer: You're fuckin' with me. I know you are.

question: 'Course I am -- but doesn't mean I won't leave you here. If you believe anything about me, better be that.
answer: No, you see, I promised them...I have to...I have to go and....

question: Step aboard, Carolyn.
answer: I can't....I can't....

question: Here. Make it easy on you.
answer: Don't do this to me....

question: Just give me your hand.
answer: But they...they could still be....

question: No one's gonna blame you. C'mon. Take my hand and save yourself, Carolyn.
answer: I will not give up on them! I Will not leave anyone on this rock with those fucking things, even if it means --

question: You'd die for them?
answer: I would try for them.

question: You barely know them.
answer: But I'm human. I know you view that as a weakness, but I'm sorry -- I do feel fear, theirs too. Goddamnit, Riddick -- yes. I would die for them.
